greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Squarefree part of n!: n! divided by its largest square divisor.
comment: Smallest number such that n!*a(n) is a square.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3386 (next term has 1001 digits)
Kevin A. Broughan, Asymptotic Order of the Square-free Part of N!, Integers, 2 (2002), Article A.10.
Rafael Jakimczuk, On the h-th free part of the factorial, International Mathematical Forum, Vol. 12, 2017, no. 13, 629-634.
formula: log a(n) ~ n log 2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 03 2012
sqrt(n!) = A055772(n) * sqrt(a(n)). - _Alonso del Arte_, Feb 16 2015
mathematica: Table[#/Last@ Select[Divisors@ #, IntegerQ@ Sqrt@ # &] &[n!], {n, 26}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 02 2016 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 19 2000
